'''Notes'''
I got this laptop as a faulty under windows 7 but found to run quite fine with Ubuntu Oneiric. Initially it was crashing or freezing after booting into gnome. Once ACPI was disabled laptop started to become stable. It means however no suspend or battery information. For that reason I could not test those functions. Other than that everything works fine including multimedia buttons under the keyboard. I couldn't also test HDMI, ESATA or expansion port as I don't have such a devices.
This is my second case where laptop with hardware fault can still be used under Linux.
Some keyboard function keys on keyboard don't work. Those include:
* touchpad switch off (there are two - over the touchpad and on the keyboard)
* wifi switch off
* screen lock

I have fired bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-video-nouveau/+bug/890912 but I am closing it as it is most probably linked to the hardware failure.
